virtual string vrt::ContextAssocLists::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::Record.

virtual ValueType vrt::ContextAssocLists::getFieldType ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the type associated with a given field.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.

void vrt::ContextAssocLists::setAsynchronousChannel ( const vector< int32_t > &  val,
const vector< int32_t > &  tags 
)

Sets the Asynchronous-Channel Association List.

Parameters:
val The association list (an arry of length 0 if there are no entries).
tags The tag list (an arry of length 0 if there are no entries or null if not specified). The inclusion of the tag list is optional; if it is included, it must have the same length as list.
Exceptions:
VRTException if tags is given but has an invalid length.
See also:
getAsynchronousChannelTag()

Sets the Asynchronous-Channel Association List.

This is identical to setAsynchronousChannel(list,null).
